page.title: 11Four Oaks Farming.
page.content: At the Middle School, across our playground, they rear chickens and ducks. They have six chickens and the average number of eggs laid each week is 3 dozen. Each six eggs are sold for 40 pence which brings in Â£2 to Â£2.80 per week. The breed are Warrens and are 15 months old. They have been laying for about 12 months. They eat 'layers' mash and drink water, They have grit to help them digest their food. On April 16 1985, Middle School put 8 duck eggs in an incubator, seven days later they added 12 hen's eggs. Between May 13th and 15th six ducks and seven chikens hatched. It was very exciting watching them grow.3 ducks are being kept for the school pond. 2 have gone to an 'old people's home' and one to a child. The cockerels have gone to a farm and the hens kept for laying eggs at school.
